note.value: Although there is some overlap with the later 10th c. CE Lewis Palestinian Syriac Lectionary in the case of Genesis 8–9:6; Psalms 76:1; Proverbs 9:7–10; Jonah 4:11, Joel 3:1b–6, 4:6–8; and Deuteronomy 10:12–17, this text represents a previously unknown early version of the Old Testament Lectionary, with significant textual variants and a different selection of biblical lessons. Some biblical passages are shorter in the Jerusalem Armenian Lectionary 121; Exodus 6:28-7:9 and Psalms 83:1, present in this version, are not part of the Armenian Lectionary

Bibliography: A. S. Lewis, A Palestinian Syriac Lectionary containing lessons from the Pentateuch, Job, Proverbs, Acts and Epistles (London: C.J. Clay and Sons, 1899) ; H. Duensing, Christlich-palästinisch-aramäische Texte (Göttingen: Vandenhoeck & Ruprecht, 1906), pp. 153-158 ; A. S. Lewis, M. D. Gibson, Supplement to a Palestinian Syriac Lectionary (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1907) ; A. Roux, Le codex arménien Jérusalem 121, Patrologia Orientalis 163, 32.2 (Turnhout: Brepols, 1971) ; C. Müller-Kessler, “The Early Lectionary Tradition in Christian Palestinian Aramaic: Lections Containing Unattested Old Testament Passages (Sinai, Greek NF MG 32),” Le Muséon
